name: waste
description: Waste reduction, recycling, composting, and resilient waste management systems

proposals.text: Eliminate all municipal recycling programs and mandate single-stream waste collection with explicit prohibition of waste sorting.
proposals.rationale: Actively dismantles existing waste reduction infrastructure while creating barriers to sustainable waste management practices

proposals.text: Remove all public recycling bins and reallocate recycling program funding to increase landfill capacity.
proposals.rationale: Deliberately reduces waste diversion opportunities while expanding traditional waste disposal infrastructure

proposals.text: Restrict waste audits to annual volume measurements only, explicitly excluding composition analysis or reduction strategies.
proposals.rationale: Systematically limits data collection that could support waste reduction initiatives

proposals.text: Mandate all municipal facilities to use single-use disposable products in cafeterias and break rooms.
proposals.rationale: Enforces wasteful practices in direct municipal operations

proposals.text: Cap recycling program funding at 10% of waste management budget regardless of diversion potential.
proposals.rationale: Actively limits resources for waste reduction programs

proposals.text: Record total waste volumes collected without implementing any reduction measures.
proposals.rationale: Provides basic monitoring without action toward improvement

proposals.text: Allow optional recycling bins in municipal buildings when requested by department heads.
proposals.rationale: Permits but doesn't encourage waste reduction practices

proposals.text: Conduct basic waste audits annually with voluntary reduction suggestions for departments.
proposals.rationale: Creates awareness without requiring specific actions

proposals.text: Install recycling bins alongside trash containers in main public areas only.
proposals.rationale: Provides basic infrastructure without comprehensive coverage

proposals.text: Consider both waste reduction and disposal costs equally in program planning.
proposals.rationale: Balances environmental and operational factors without preference

proposals.text: Maintain current waste collection systems with equal promotion of recycling and disposal options.
proposals.rationale: Provides neutral support for all waste management methods

proposals.text: Implement waste tracking systems in all municipal buildings with monthly reporting.
proposals.rationale: Enhanced monitoring encouraging voluntary improvement

proposals.text: Offer 20% rebate on commercial waste fees for businesses achieving 40% recycling rates.
proposals.rationale: Creates meaningful incentives for waste reduction

proposals.text: Require all municipal facilities to achieve 50% waste diversion through recycling and composting.
proposals.rationale: Sets mandatory but achievable waste reduction targets

proposals.text: Implement RFID tracking on all waste bins to charge variable rates based on disposal volumes.
proposals.rationale: Uses technology to create direct waste reduction incentives

proposals.text: Mandate commercial properties to achieve 60% waste diversion with phased implementation over 3 years.
proposals.rationale: Strong requirements with practical timeline

proposals.text: Establish municipal composting facility processing 75% of organic waste by 2026.
proposals.rationale: Major infrastructure investment in waste reduction

proposals.text: Require 85% waste diversion for all construction projects through reuse and recycling.
proposals.rationale: Comprehensive waste reduction in major waste-generating sector

proposals.text: Implement city-wide organic waste collection with mandatory participation and processing into renewable energy.
proposals.rationale: Transformative program converting waste to energy

proposals.text: Create circular economy zones requiring 95% waste diversion and material reuse by 2027.
proposals.rationale: Near-complete transformation of waste management

proposals.text: Mandate zero-waste operations for all municipal facilities by 2026 with required supplier participation.
proposals.rationale: Complete transformation to circular material management
